title: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
description: Bug 13725: Revert is much slower than close and reopen in java editor.
OB: When I answer 'no' to the 'do you want to save changes' dialog and then double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it, the file opens quickly. However, if I repeat steps 1) and 2), and then select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor, it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
EB: This seems odd since reverting the file contents ought not to take more time than closing and reopening the file.
SR:
1. Open a file in the java editor.
2. Make some changes to the file.
3. Answer 'no' when prompted to save changes.
4. Double click on the file in the navigator to reopen it.
5. Repeat steps 3) and 4).
6. Select 'Revert' from the pop-up menu in the editor.
7. Observe that it takes 15 seconds to replace the contents of the window with the original.
